alert.note: Alert for Limestone (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 12:46PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Limestone and southern Lincoln Counties through 130 PM CDT... At 1246 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ardmore, or 16 miles southwest of Fayetteville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and dime to penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fayetteville, Ardmore, Howell, Dellrose, Mimosa, Cash Point, Skinem, Molino, Holland Gin and Coldwater. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for north central Alabama...and Middle Tennessee.
